result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricky W. SCHMIDT was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraud/Rendering Income Tax Return, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 71.83(2)(b)1.
  • Fraud/Rendering Income Tax Return, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 71.83(2)(b)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes:
Pay $400.00 restitution to Federal Mogul, joint and several with Jonathan Thompson.
Pay $9,405.00 restitution to Ariens Company, Attn. Fred Moreaux, 644 West Ryan Street, Brillion, WI, joint and several with Jonathan Thompson.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample.  

Defendant is not allowed to be involved in the salvage business or profit from any salvage business as a shareholder or officer.

Pay tax penalties as being negotiated.

timeConds.notes:
Six (6) months, under the Huber Law, to commence immediately. 
Six (6) months, stayed to be imposed upon the agent's discretion.
Court authorizes out of county travel for employment purposes.

All records scanned and verified.

Order Granting Furlough.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant be grantd this furlough extension.  It is further ordered that the time the defendant is away from the jail shall be added on to the end of the defendant's original release date; time for time.  He has 108 days remaining to serve on this sentence.
Copy to jail.
For records from State of Wisconsin DOJ

Transcript of the Plea and Sentencing Hearing held on 09/09/2015.
Original transcript is on file in case no.:  15 CF 521.

Order Granting Furlough.
The Court hereby orders that the defendant be granted this furlough.  He may be released on this furlough upon signature of the judge to commence on 11-19-15 at 1700 hrs. through 12-19-15 at 0800.  Defendant is to stay in contact with the Huber Sgt. or jail authorities during this furlough as directed and his return to jail date and time will be determined by jail health services unit.  His furlough return date and time may be extended by jail health services unit if granted by sentencing judge.   It is further ordered that the time the defendant is away from the jail shall be added on to the end of the defendant's original release date; time for time.  His release date is currently 03-07-16 at 1700 hrs.  He has 108 days remaining to serve on this sentence.
Copy to jail.
Adding $9,405 restitution to Ariens Company, joint and several with Jonathan Thompson.

Order to Amend the Judgment of Conviction.
Based upon the stipulation of the parties, the judgment of conviction is hereby amended to include as a condition of supervision on both counts, that the defendant pay, joint and several with co-defendant Jonathan Thompson, the amount of $9,405 to Ariens Company, Attn: Fred Moreaux, 655 West Ryan Street, Brillion, WI 54110-1072.
